pull.title: C++11: s/boost::scoped_ptr/std::unique_ptr/
pull.body: I asked @sipa what to use in C++11 instead of introducing a new boost::scoped_ptr and he answered std::unique_ptr. Then I realized that completely replacing boost::scoped_ptr with std::unique_ptr is currently quite trivial, just a diff of +11 -11.

events.body:
Please also remove the include (https://github.com/paveljanik/bitcoin/commit/775ac957b7754dd8d1d51a93d5d6dc85fbbfc3bc).

cACK (compilesACK) https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/06a214aeaaa6ef12c11c20bb774ff0e065707afc

> Please also remove the include (paveljanik@775ac95).

Agreed. I'm surprised that that's the only instance.

@paveljanik Good catch! I greped boost/scoped_ptr but saw a bunch of hits in .Po files and missed that one.
It is still being included implicitly to the other places somehow, but yeah, that include had to go.
